definitions.definition: An official summons or notice given to a person to appear.
The paper containing such summons or notice.
The act of citing a passage from a book, or from another person, in his/her own words.
An entry in a list of source(s) from which one took information, words or literary or verbal context.
The passage or words quoted; quotation.
A quotation with attached bibliographical details demonstrating the use of a particular lexical item in a dictionary, especially a dictionary on historical principles.

definitions.example: It's a simple citation of facts.

definitions.definition: A reference to decided cases, or books of authority, to prove a point in law.
A commendation in recognition of some achievement, or a formal statement of an achievement.
